014package org.jdbi.v3.stringtemplate4;
015
016import java.net.URL;
017import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
018import java.util.Collections;
019import java.util.Map;
020import java.util.WeakHashMap;
021import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
022
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.locator.internal.ClasspathBuilder;
024import org.stringtemplate.v4.ST;
025import org.stringtemplate.v4.STGroup;
026import org.stringtemplate.v4.STGroupFile;
027
028/**
029 * Locates SQL in <code>.sql.stg</code> StringTemplate group files on the classpath.
030 */
031public class StringTemplateSqlLocator {
032    private static final Map<ClassLoader, Map<String, ThreadLocal<STGroup>>> CACHE = Collections.synchronizedMap(new WeakHashMap<>());
033
034    private StringTemplateSqlLocator() {}
035
036    /**
037     * Locates SQL for the given type and name. Example: Given a type <code>com.foo.Bar</code> and a name of
038     * <code>baz</code>, loads a StringTemplate group file from the resource named <code>com/foo/Bar.sql.stg</code> on
039     * the classpath, and returns the template with the given name from the group.
040     *
041     * @param type the type that "owns" the given StringTemplate group file. Dictates the filename of the
042     *             StringTemplate group file on the classpath.
043     * @param name the template name within the StringTemplate group.
044     * @return the located SQL.
045     */
046    public static ST findStringTemplate(Class<?> type, String name) {
047        STGroup group = findStringTemplateGroup(type);
048
049        if (!group.isDefined(name)) {
050            throw new IllegalStateException("No StringTemplate group " + name + " for class " + type);
051        }
052
053        return group.getInstanceOf(name);
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Locates SQL for the given type and name. Loads a StringTemplate group from the resource at the given path,
058     * and returns the template with the given name from the group.
059     *
060     * @param path the resource path for the StringTemplate group.
061     * @param name the template name within the StringTemplate group.
062     * @return the located SQL.
063     */
064    public static ST findStringTemplate(String path, String name) {
065        STGroup group = findStringTemplateGroup(path);
066
067        return findTemplateInGroup(path, name, group);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Locates SQL for the given type and name. Loads a StringTemplate group from the resource at the given path,
072     * and returns the template with the given name from the group.
073     *
074     * @param classLoader the classloader from which to load the resource.
075     * @param path the resource path for the StringTemplate group.
076     * @param name the template name within the StringTemplate group.
077     * @return the located SQL.
078     */
079    public static ST findStringTemplate(ClassLoader classLoader, String path, String name) {
080        STGroup group = findStringTemplateGroup(classLoader, path);
081
082        return findTemplateInGroup(path, name, group);
083    }
084
085    private static ST findTemplateInGroup(String path, String name, STGroup group) {
086        if (!group.isDefined(name)) {
087            throw new IllegalStateException("No StringTemplate group " + name + " for path " + path);
088        }
089
090        return group.getInstanceOf(name);
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Loads the StringTemplateGroup for the given type. Example: Given a type <code>com.foo.Bar</code>, returns a
095     * StringTemplateGroup loaded from the resource named <code>com/foo/Bar.sql.stg</code> on the classpath.
096     *
097     * @param type the type that "owns" the given StringTemplate group file. Dictates the filename of the
098     *             StringTemplate group file on the classpath.
099     * @return the loaded StringTemplateGroup.
100     */
101    public static STGroup findStringTemplateGroup(Class<?> type) {
102        String path = new ClasspathBuilder()
103            .appendFullyQualifiedClassName(type)
104            .setExtension("sql.stg")
105            .build();
106
107        return findStringTemplateGroup(type.getClassLoader(), path);
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Loads the StringTemplateGroup from the given path on the classpath.
112     *
113     * @param path the resource path on the classpath.
114     * @return the loaded StringTemplateGroup.
115     */
116    public static STGroup findStringTemplateGroup(String path) {
117        return findStringTemplateGroup(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader(), path);
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Loads the StringTemplateGroup from the given path on the classpath.
122     *
123     * @param classLoader the classloader from which to load the resource.
124     * @param path the resource path on the classpath.
125     * @return the loaded StringTemplateGroup.
126     */
127    public static STGroup findStringTemplateGroup(ClassLoader classLoader, String path) {
128        return CACHE.computeIfAbsent(classLoader, x -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>())
129                    .computeIfAbsent(path, p -> ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> readStringTemplateGroup(classLoader, path))).get();
130    }
131
132    private static STGroup readStringTemplateGroup(ClassLoader classLoader, String path) {
133        try {
134            URL resource = classLoader.getResource(path);
135            STGroupFile group = new STGroupFile(resource, StandardCharsets.UTF_8.name(), '<', '>');
136            group.load();
137            return group;
138        } catch (Exception e) {
139            throw new RuntimeException("Unable to read StringTemplate group file at " + path + " on classpath", e);
140        }
141    }
142}
